data.title: Bachelor of Applied Science in Information Technology
data.meta_description: The KSU Bachelor of Applied Science in Information Technology (I.T.) degree provides you with the knowledge to develop a strategy for integrating integrated computing and I.T. systems.
data.text:
The Bachelor of Applied Science (B.A.S.) in Information Technology degree program is designed for you if you have an Associate of Applied Science in computing from a member institution of the Technical College System of Georgia (TSCG).

The B.A.S. at KSU can prepare you for many solid careers, from software developers and programmers to cybersecurity specialists. It can be an excellent stepping stone to more advanced degrees and career opportunities in the computer technology field. You will develop the skills needed to design, implement and maintain computer systems and networks for data processing and distribution.

As an I.T. professional, you'll develop creative problem-solving techniques and highly developed technical skills with strong logical and critical thinking capabilities.

Additionally, this B.A.S. degree is fully accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineers & Technology (ABET).

If you have an Associate of Applied Science (A.A.S.) in a computing field from the following list with a G.P.A. of 2.3 or better from a Technical College System of Georgia (TCSG) college, you can transfer into the B.A.S. degree program.

Your (A.A.S.) degree should be earned from one of the following Technical College System of Georgia (TCSG) Colleges:
